intro: Tetracera kampotensis, commonly known as the Kampot tetracera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in Cambodia, Vietnam, and Thailand. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows in tropical moist lowland forests and is often found near water sources. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
